overview: Convert the README from a monolithic guide with embedded file contents into a proper documentation hub that references the actual files in this repository. Extract missing templates as standalone files.
note: Task IDs are for reference only. Order is determined dynamically.

tasks.name: Create missing template files
tasks.description:
Extract the following files from README.md into standalone files:
- templates/CLAUDE.md.template - Project context template
- templates/progress.txt.template - Initial progress log
- templates/.claudeignore - File exclusion template
- templates/.git-hooks/pre-push - Git safety hook
- UI_TESTING.md - UI testing standards
- prds/PRD_REFINE.md - PRD quality check prompt
- prds/new-prd.sh - Helper script to create new PRDs

Use a 'templates/' directory for files that users copy into their projects.
acceptanceCriteria: All template files exist as standalone files
Content matches what's described in README.md

tasks.name: Reconcile script differences
tasks.description: Compare the actual scripts (ralph-start.sh, ralph-clone.sh, ralph-once.sh) with the README versions. Document which version is correct (likely the actual files are newer/improved). Update README references to point to the actual files as the source of truth.
acceptanceCriteria: Documented differences between README and actual files
Decision made on which version is canonical
README reflects that actual files are the source of truth

tasks.name: Restructure README to reference files
tasks.description:
Transform README.md from containing full file contents to referencing the actual files. For each script/file:
- Remove the heredoc/cat block with full contents
- Add a link to the actual file in the repo
- Keep brief description of what the file does
- Optionally show key usage examples

The README should become a guide that says 'see [ralph-start.sh](ralph-start.sh) for the script' rather than embedding the entire script.
acceptanceCriteria: No duplicated file contents in README
All scripts/templates are linked from README
README still readable as a guide
File references use relative paths that work on GitHub

tasks.name: Add directory structure section
tasks.description: Add a section to README showing the repo structure and explaining what each file/directory is for. This helps users understand what they're getting.
acceptanceCriteria: README has a clear 'Repository Structure' or similar section
All files and directories are explained
Purpose of templates/ vs root scripts is clear

tasks.name: Update setup instructions
tasks.description:
Update the setup instructions in README to:
- Clone this repo (or copy files from it)
- Copy templates/ files to project
- Reference the actual script files
- Remove instructions to 'create' files via cat/heredoc
acceptanceCriteria: Setup instructions reference cloning/copying from repo
No more 'cat > filename << EOF' blocks for scripts that exist
Clear distinction between 'copy these templates' and 'install these scripts'
